thread.title: Blackburn v Manchester United: Jose Mourinho actually applauds stunning Rovers goal in FA Cup tie | Metro News
thread.title_full: Blackburn v Manchester United: Jose Mourinho actually applauds stunning Rovers goal in FA Cup tie | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Blackburn v Manchester United: Jose Mourinho actually applauds stunning Rovers goal in FA Cup tie | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 4:55 pm Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty) 
Even Jose Mourinho was impressed by Blackburn Rovers’ opener in the FA Cup tie against Manchester United . 
The struggling Championship outfit put their dismal league run to one side to take a surprising lead against Mourinho’s United. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Dutch forward Marvin Emnes started the clash at Ewood Park brightly and helped the hosts stun United after shrugging off Marcos Rojo and playing through Danny Graham. 
Blackburn’s top goalscorer, who had spells at Watford, Swansea City and Sunderland before joining Rovers, steered a superb finish past Sergio Romero to complete a move that even seemed to impress Mourinho. 
The Portuguese boss was seen nodding his head and clapping after the 17th-minute goal – although he reacted with even more enthusiasm after Marcus Rashford equalised 10 minutes later. 
— BT Sport Football (@btsportfootball) February 19, 2017 
The England international latched onto a wonderful through ball from Henrikh Mkhitaryan before gliding past stopper Jason Steele and firing home into an empty net.
